label: morpheme
description: The [smallest](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/small#Adjective) [linguistic unit](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/linguistic_unit) within a [word](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/word#Noun) that can [carry](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/carry#Verb) a [meaning](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/meaning#Noun).

label: prefix
description: A [morpheme](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/morpheme) added to the beginning of a word to modify its meaning.

label: root
description: The part of a word that forms its core and gives its most basic meaning; also the part of the word that is left when all [affixes](#affix) are removed. For example, in [_insubordination_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/insubordination#English), the root is _ord_, while in [_unspeakableness_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/unspeakableness#English) it is [_speak_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/speak#English). The root is often the first part of the word (as in [Uralic](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Uralic) and often in [Indo-European](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Indo-European) languages), but it may also be the last part, or it may only consist of the consonants of the word (as in the [Afroasiatic](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Afroasiatic) languages).

label: suffix
description: A [morpheme](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/morpheme) added to the end of a word to modify its meaning.
